intro: Piriqueta fulva, commonly known as the yellow piriqueta, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and umbel-shaped inflorescence.
